snippet: As temperatures rise, analysts predict that scores of the nation’s ski centers, especially those at lower elevations and latitudes, will eventually vanish.
abstract: Analysts predict that many of the nation's ski centers, especially those at lower elevations and latitudes, will eventually vanish as a result of rising temperatures; threat of global warming hangs over almost every resort across the country, with forecasts that more than half of the 103 ski resorts in the Northeast will not be able to maintain a 100-day season by 2039; resorts are adapting and remain optimistic face of dire predictions.

byline.contributor: Jack Healy contributed reporting from Denver.

lead_paragraph: As temperatures rise, analysts predict that scores of the nation’s ski centers, especially those at lower elevations and latitudes, will eventually vanish.
